news.content: Presented our paper on neurotic robots at IEEE RO-MAN in Eindhoven, the Netherlands.
Our paper on a digital journaling tool to support newcomers was accepted to ACM CSCW 2025.
Started MMath in CS at UWaterloo, supervised by Edith Law.
Graduated from UNB with a BCS (Honours) and a BA in Philosophy.
Awarded NSERC Graduate Scholarship (CGS M) at UWaterloo.
Awarded NSERC Undergraduate Student Research Award (USRA) at UNB to work with Daniel Rea for the summer.

education.program: Master of Mathematics in Computer Science
Bachelor of Computer Science with Honours
Bachelor of Arts with a Major in Philosophy

experience.description: Developed company software using ReactJS, React Native, and Spring Boot frameworks.

experience.company: University of New Brunswick Human-Computer Interaction Lab
experience.description: Designed, prepared, and ran informal pilot studies for a user study with a modified Roomba robot.
Worked in an Agile environment to develop web applications using React, Spring Boot, and Java Server Faces.
Worked as a full stack web developer to implement new features and bug fixes for an ASP.NET web application.
Worked in an Agile environment to develop a monolithic application using Spring Boot and Struts.

publications.title: LTJ: A Capability-based Digital Journaling Tool to Support Well-being of Newcomers in Life Transition
publications.authors: Nabil Bin Hannan, Casey O'Neill, Anthony Maocheia-Ricci and Edith Law

publications.title: "Help Me, I'm Feeling Down!" - Neurotic Robots Increase Bystander Engagement
publications.authors: Toushal Sewruttun, Casey O'Neill, Edith Law, and Daniel J. Rea

coursework.title: Comparing the Effects of Verbal and Nonverbal Robot Cues on Perceived Confidence
Using an Augmented Reality Exercise Game to Improve Exercise Experience
coursework.course: CS889 (Research Methods in HCI), University of Waterloo, 2024
